Roles & Responsibilities  Team: Enterprise Services Operations team Location: Singapore   Microsoft Services mission is to lead and serve our customers and partners as they realize their full potential in a mobile-first, cloud-first world. We are a diverse group of technical architects, engineers, consultants and support professionals, more than 21,000 strong, serving customers in 191 countries and 46 languages. We drive over $5B in revenue annually.    Services continues to be the key differentiator in accelerating a customer transformation ensuring they get the most out of their technology investments. In order to support Microsoft’s transformation, we must continue to evolve what we sell, how we sell, how we deliver, how we operate, and how we drive consumption for the company.   Enterprise Services (ES) worldwide delivery organization focused on Global Domain Delivery. This new delivery model was designed to better align Delivery resources and support end-to-end offerings for our customers. Global Domains are aligned by technology and include a broad set of global expertise to create an agile delivery team that supports the customer lifecycle from pre-sales, to implementation, to proactive services.    Responsibilities     The ES Operations team which is part Planning and Business Excellence organization has a mandate to partner with Domain and Account aligned delivery Leadership to achieve Operational Excellence. As a part of this endeavor we have an opening for a seasoned Planning & Insights leader to partner with the Enterprise Services Leaders.  Deliver robust annual/ quarterly delivery planning (demand and capacity plans) for both Consulting and Premier business by providing key insights / inputs from Areas / Time zones to central planning & domain facing planning team and vice versa. Collaborate with diverse set of stakeholders in Areas, Multi-sub areas, subsidiaries on delivery planning syndicate with Finance and GCM counterparts and ensure an integrated plan is built between Areas and domains on demand and capacity for ES business Support clarity across area and domains on planning inputs/outputs and connected processes / RACIs Provide leadership in enabling the below challenges to represent before appropriate forums / decision makers for resolution and circle back to the respective stakeholders     Accuracy and Feasibility of Domain & Area Interlock Capacity distribution across Multi Sub Area & Sales Locations Area specific capacity around Language, Pub-Sec, Security Cleared Balance area needs and specifics with affordability and all up plan Monitor and revise Area /Sub level Resource and PPG Mix Sold Margin vs. Delivery Margin at Area Level Respond and clarify Area concerns on Demand & Capacity Drive Premier One Plan Process in Areas Provide insights from Areas on PNEH, Burn rate, service mix, technology mix relating to premier delivery Area Presales Planning & maintenance Area pivot for CFO Forecasting Support monthly & adhoc capacity analytics requirements (TZ, Area & Sales Location) level Deliver capacity insights for Area xBUs     Provide forward looking business visibility based on advanced statistical analytics, predictive models and deep insights (Scenario modelling, Trend Analysis, Correlations/ Knowledge Discovery, Machine Learning, Statistical Forecasting, Early Warning System etc.). Ability to handle large, complex and disparate data sets; build models ground up, interpret the story behind the numbers and syndicate the output with broader set of stakeholders. Identify trends and inconsistencies in data to provide perspective and business solutions. Present data-driven analyses to solve complex business problems. Provide analytics and insights to the business leaders to have consequential business review rhythms (QBR/ MBR) by closely monitoring the Key Performance Indicators, Critical Success Factors, Scorecard Metric, Cost and Productivity levers, Sales Motion, Leading/ Lagging Indicators, Red Pockets, Root Cause Analyses, Recovery Plans, Investments/ ROIs. Enable the business leaders on Governance, Control and Compliance aspects.  Key Success Criteria and Competencies required   Future orientation balanced with current state through strategic and systems thinking and a global mindset Influencing stakeholders to achieve impact through collaboration, presence and strong communication skills Judgment based Scoping of problems by identifying key issues, inputs, stakeholders, and outcomes. Applies a broad functional knowledge base to solve problems with confidence and persuades others Dealing with Ambiguity Change Management Analytical problem solving​ RequirementsQualifications   Experience and Qualification include:   Ideal candidates should have 15+ years of experience in areas related to Planning, Analytics, Finance, Operations, services delivery etc., and should be self-motivated, confident in working with Senior Leaders and comfortable working in a matrix organization. The candidate need to be able to achieve results through influence across multiple organizations.    Bachelors in business, information technology, Finance , Operations or related field, and/or equivalent experience Proven stakeholder management skills, especially in a cross organizational matrixed teams A strong business aptitude coupled with an affinity or appreciation for technology and the advancement of technology in thriving organizations Ability to effectively prioritize and coordinate multiple work streams of activities Knowledge and understanding of the financial and operational functions of a delivery organization (i.e., budget, time logging, optimizing cost, escalation processes, invoicing, capacity management) Ability to develop strong, productive relationships with colleagues and management to meet targeted objectives An analytical mindset with the ability define metrics, reports, interpret results, and make recommendations on appropriate courses of action Excellent communication, collaboration, organizational, time management, presentation, and writing skills Proactive, self-motivated, and team-oriented with strong capabilities to lead and thrive in start-up type organizations​    Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.   Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Title: SAP PP - MM Senior Consultant Job Description: This is for candidate who has both specialize SAP knowledge on Production Planning and Material Management. Candidate must have implementation experience and be able to work as an individual contributor during the implementation period. Responsibilities:  You will be part of full project lifecycle experience including design, data, functional specs, configuration, testing and post go live support experience Assess and recommend solutions according to scope and to resolve open design issues Configuration of PP to support scope; document configuration rationale Develop Functional Specs for all relevant developments to support PP processes integrate with SAP MM Develop / Update relevant Master Data Standards especially master data to support PP processes integrate with SAP MM Update existing Business Process Flows (Solman) and Business Process Design Documents for their process areas as required Confirm security roles for implementation with security team Confirm risks and controls for implementation by the GRC team Design metrics and reports to support operational and management reporting for PP-MM; write reporting functional specs Prepare integration test scripts Complete unit testing, integration testing and support user acceptance testing RequirementsRequirements:  At least more than 8 years of strong experience in ECC SAP PP and MM. Must have 4 cycles of end to end implementation project in a consulting environment Business processes and solutions for Master Data, Forecasting, Procurement, Inventory Management, Quality Management, Demand Planning, MRP, Product Development. Design, develop, test, debug and implement programs on SAP ECC 6.0 or above. Develop solutions for all business processes in SAP systems. Support other IT areas as assigned including non-SAP business systems You must be able to lead technical design and implementation services You must know how to handle our existing clients well and be client oriented with excellent problem-solving skills. It would be great if you have excellent analytical, presentation, soft skills and able to write clearly and concisely Working in tight deadlines and short notice is very common You must possess some personal attributes such as creativity, positive thinking, quick learning, imagination, leadership, judgment and maturity, curiosity, strong interpersonal skills, professional integrity and initiative. Able to start in a short notice period. Consulting background is preferable.

job_details: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCanopy (https://canopy.cloud) is a "make sense of your data" financial technology startup. We provide aggregation, visualization, analytics, and reporting services to financial institutions, wealth managers, and high net-worth individuals. Our company is only successful when Canopy is actively used by our clients and that's why we are looking for a Client Success Analyst to join our team. What you’ll do As a Canopy Client Success Analyst, you will be responsible for working closely with our clients to achieve their goals, monitor their account health and drive engagement activities. You have a passion for delivering good client service and you will constantly think of ways to improve the client experience. Primary responsibilities:  Handle day-to-day client requests and issues, and work with the relevant team (data/product) to escalate and follow through on cases Manage the onboarding of new clients: initial orientation and organize training sessions for clients to ensure they’re getting the most of Canopy Proactively engage with our clients to improve the overall client journey and experience Build and strengthen our relationships with our clients Analyze user engagement data, identify actionable insights and implement target models to ensure our company is focused on client success Develop and maintain relevant post-sales marketing materials Create content and maintain Canopy support site Provide input into the product development and feature prioritization Conduct User Acceptance Testing (UAT) for new product releases to ensure they are ready for our clients Assist with sales and marketing efforts on an ad-hoc basis  Benefits:  Fun and ambitious start-up Chance to make a real impact – and be rewarded for it! Direct access to CXOs and fast career progression Performance based equity awards Medical insurance Singapore Business Review, Hottest Startup 2016 || Pathfinder 2017, Top 50 Global Financial IT Startup || UBS Future of Finance, Global Finalist 2015 || Singapore Fintech Festival, Finalist || Asian Private Banker, Technology Awards 2015. Credit Suisse is our first major client (https://www.credit-suisse.com/corporate/en/articles/media-releases/cs-enhances-digital-private-banking-with-fintech-201703.html); with more on the way! Requirements +2 years relevant work experience in client services / user engagement are preferred. Fresh (or recent) graduates are welcome to apply Exposure to banking or wealth management industry Good understanding of financial instruments & capital markets (& FinTech industry!) Interest in technology and able to grasp concepts quickly Excellent communication skills – both verbal and written Enthusiastic with strong desire for continuous learning and improvement Highly self-motivated and ambitious in achieving goals Able to balance competing priorities and manage multiple projects at the same time Willingness to learn new things and get your hands dirty!

Roles & ResponsibilitiesReporting to the Manager of the Basic Design, Stability, Mooring and Weight Control Department, the incumbent will be assigned to Stability & Mooring or Weight Control team. Stability & Mooring team is responsible to support the analysis, design and testing of Stability & Mooring for new offshore structures and vessels through exploration, sourcing and development of new range of stability and mooring control methods and systems to suit the operating needs in a different environment. Weight control team is responsible to prepares key project documentation (i.e.weight control procedures, weight reducing proposals and loading condition, and etc.) for weight design in bid packages, equipment data sheets and contract specifications. Responsibilities:  Prepares key project documentation, including structural design brief as specified in bid packages, equipment data sheets and contract specifications to develop trim, stability and loading manual and etc. for project execution Prepares rough sketches, drawings, general arrangement, capacity and lines plans and other engineering data on stability & mooring by utilising engineering common network, software and tools Prepares hull form, geometry plan, tank plan, hydrostatic and tank sounding table, (i.e. based on motion analysis, risers analysis and air gap analysis) to determine volume and positioning in centre of gravity in inclining test Prepares and optimises vessel specific test procedures and calculations for vessel stability & mooring in lightweight survey and load line (i.e.longitudinal strength, intact stability and damage stability conditions) Performs studies to explore and design new optimal lightweight offshore structures and vessels, focusing on their operating requirements and weight optimisation under the supervision of senior team members Prepares weight forecasts and investigations, emphasising on weight information to determine the selection of materials (MTOs) and equipments as weight saving alternatives during the design phase Participates in weight assessment audit to determine the preliminary weight inputs (i.e.unit weight budget) provided by the engineering disciplines comply with the defined budget weight under the supervision of senior team members Prepares weight calculations and centre of gravity (COG) to identify trends and areas for optimisation, including monitoring weight changes to alert management on the exceeded lightship design weight for further solutions Coordinates with other engineering team members (i.e.structural/ general design/ Stability&Mooring/weight control), subcontractors and consultants on technical issues and design solutions Requirements Bachelor’s degree in  Naval Architecture/ Structural Engineering/ or related engineering disciplines 5 years of  relevant experience in stability & mooring/ weight control and basic design in oil and gas  projects Advanced user of Microsoft Office products, AutoCAD, STAAD, and Adobe Acrobat Possess working knowledge or fundamentals in naval architecture, hydrodynamic, and engineering principles Knowledge of engineering analysis techniques and tools/software applications used in naval architectural engineering  Knowledge in the studies and optimisation of hull form using CFD techniques coupled with model testing for the purpose of minimising resistance or improvement of sea-keeping performance    Our Address Sembcorp Marine Ltd Tanjong Kling Yard 29 Tanjong Kling Road Singapore 628054 Tuas Boulevard Yard 80 Tuas South Boulevard Singapore 637051 Mon-Thu : 7.30am – 5.15pm Fri : 7.30am – 4.15pm Interested candidates with relevant background are invited to send us an updated resume with your current and expected salary, reason of application and earliest availability to kenneth.cheng@sembmarine.com. Please ensure that the Position Title or Reference Code (if available) is clearly stated in your Subject Line. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Please note that your personal data disclosed to Sembcorp Marine Ltd and our group of companies, shall be used for the purposes of evaluation, and processing in accordance with our recruitment processes and policies. By providing your personal data, you have consented to the aforesaid purpose under the provisions of the Personal Data Protection Act 2012.

work_location: THE HOUSE OF EDEN, 4 ROBINSON ROAD 048543
job_details: Roles & ResponsibilitiesXaxis is an agency of GroupM, the world’s largest media investment company and are a part of WPP. In fact, we are responsible for one in every three ads you see globally.   We are currently looking for a Senior Manager to join the Programmatic Trading team for Xaxis Singapore. The Programmatic Trading team at the heart of all Xaxis activity, and is pivotal to the success of each campaign that is executed. We work in a close-knit pod structure to support our clients. We are looking for someone with a positive attitude, enthusiastic and is able to think out of the box and do better with each execution. At GroupM APAC, our people are our strength, which is why fostering a culture of diversity and inclusion is important to us.  Reporting of the role  This role reports to the Client Services Director.  3 best things about the job:  It’s a great work environment - You will collaborate with a group of quick witted, humorous, diverse and extremely dedicated colleagues who are all passionate about programmatic and making advertising welcome. Opinions and ideas are highly encouraged, and everyone has a voice at Xaxis. Ambition is expected and passion is admired. We are always open to new ways of thinking from everyone, especially those that will contribute to the overall success of Xaxis. It is never static. You are empowered to create your own balance and be proactive. There is always something new to learn, new challenges to overcome, and new technology to embrace everyday.  Measures of success – In three months:  Gain an in depth understanding of the programmatic landscape, be trained on the various Xaxis platforms and tools and have an understanding of how Xaxis operates Incorporate and recommend other aspects of the Xaxis business including audience planning and insights, Xaxis products and Xaxis Marketplace as part of the overall campaign strategy and execution Develop relationships and earn trust with your own team as well as the local market operation teams   In six months:  Work with the Engagement Team to grow key accounts’ businesses from the trading perspective Develop and identify gaps/processes/tools to improve campaign performance and efficiency  In twelve months:  Be involved with strategic planning with Engagement team and Agency Run more effient campaigns  Responsibilities of the role: Day to day responsibilities:  Be a part of a team that works together with Engagement team to support and manage programmatic campaigns across all Xaxis products Work with Engagement team on pre-campaign planning Manage the end to end process from brief through to set up, tagging checks and optimization to ensure report metrics are fully captured Strategize and execute campaigns on our platform and ensure optimal delivery and performance Analyze campaign data to develop insights and strategies for campaign optimization Provide in-depth campaign insights and optimization recommendations for campaign improvement  Strategic Responsibilities:  Bridge the gap between sales (Engagement) and Trading Provide guidance to junior members of the team Be able to drive strategic conversations with agency and client on next steps for the benefit of the campaigns Become a trusted advisor and expert within the programmatic trading field Take an active role in developing broader programmatic strategic recommendations and best practices that can be applied      About Xaxis Xaxis is a global digital media platform that programmatically connects advertisers to audiences across all addressable channels. Through the expert use of proprietary data and advertising technology along with unparalleled media relationships, Xaxis delivers results for over 2,800 clients in 40 markets across North America, Europe, Asia Pacific, Latin America and the Middle East. Advertisers working with Xaxis achieve exceptionally high return on advertising spend through the company’s proprietary media products, as well as through its wholly-owned specialist companies, Light Reaction, Bannerconnect, and ActionX.  For more information, visit www.xaxis.com. About Singapore GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients and media owners. As the largest media investment management company in Singapore with over 41% market share (Recma) and over 650 employees, GroupM Singapore is the premiere organisation to join and develop a career in. GroupM APAC is committed to fostering a culture of diversity and inclusion. Our people are our strength so we respect and nurture their individual talent and potential.RequirementsWhat you will need:  5-6 years professional experience in a related field with hands on campaign optimization and account management experience Bachelors degree in marketing, communications or a related field Hands on experience and knowledge in programmatic trading Deep understanding of DSPs/SSPs, RTB, ad exchanges, DMPs, audience targeting Experience in campaign implementation, optimization and reporting, experience with response driven/demand generation campaigns Experience in managing and dealing with multi-markets across APAC Understanding of the digital media ecosystem and technology including ad tagging and site analytics Knowledge and passion for digital marketing: digital display, digital branding, digital direct response, SEM, video & mobile Must be able to work in a fast paced environment - harvest vast amounts of information, news, data, and research and distill the most important/relevant information for your agency team and their clients.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesTower Research Capital seeks a Senior Software Developer to join the Core Engineering team who is excited to design in-house trading systems that are robust, resilient, and extremely fast. These systems enable Tower to execute algorithmic trading strategies based on patterns in market behavior. By building and maintaining this high-performance infrastructure, Tower’s developers have helped to position the firm as a leader in the field of quantitative trading. This role is available at our Singapore or Shanghai office. Responsibilities The Software Developer will be responsible for:  Designing and implementing a high-frequency trading platform, which includes collecting quotes and trades from and disseminating orders to exchanges around the world Optimizing this platform by using network and systems programming, as well as other advanced techniques to minimize latency Developing systems that provide easy access to historical market data and trading simulations Creating tools to analyze data for patterns Building risk-management and performance-tracking tools    Benefits  Competitive salary Free breakfast, lunch, and snacks on a daily basis Gym membership Five weeks of paid vacation per year plus public holidays  For employees ineligible to participate in the CPF, the cash equivalent of the employer’s CPF contribution RequirementsQualifications The ideal candidate will graduate with a degree in computer science along with:  A strong background in data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented programming in C++ Brilliant problem-solving abilities The ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment Strong communication skills in English Working knowledge of Linux Knowledge of any other development language, including Java, Python, or Perl and shell scripts (a plus)

job_details: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout the role  This is a 6 months rolling contract The incumbent will be deputed to work at a banking institution  Job Summary: The Test Manager is responsible for managing the day-to-day activities of a software test team comprised of test analysts. The person is will be responsible for the Test Case Design, Coordination, Preparation and Execution. He/she is expected to deliver high-quality test results in a timely manner by creating and implementing testing strategy, producing test plans, assisting with test case design and development as needed, driving execution of manual and automated testing, monitoring test status, and providing mentorship to team members. The role exercises independent judgment to clarify tasks, set clear project milestones, deliverables, and provides leadership to the team. This role will work directly with Development, Product Analysts, Vendor teams, Application Support, and will interact directly with end users during UAT phase. Roles and Responsibilities:  Contribute to the planning and implementation of a quality assurance framework for the software testing lifecycle of the bank Participate in the requirement analysis and identify gaps in requirement by assessing the product functionality, usability and fitness for purpose Work with project managers, development and engineering teams to ensure efficiency of system integration test cycles and propose improvements required if defects are found. This includes the technical support of all testing cycles (System Integration Testing, User Acceptance Testing) for both Technology Change the Bank and Run the Bank projects, ensuring all deliverables are aligned with technology development governance, championing and utilising Quality Assurance procedures Creating, maintaining, and executing test plans and test scenarios/cases against software platforms. Design automated test frameworks with Test Data identification to build automated regression and load tests. Promote the knowledge of manual / automation testing and defect tracking tools to help in proper tool selection and set-up. Resolve testing problems by modifying testing methods during tests, conferring with management to revise test objectives and standards. Maintain testing database by developing defect tracking and regression testing information requirements, designing information system to capture test outcomes. Report test outcomes by collecting, analyzing, interpreting, summarizing, and displaying data; recommend software changes when required. Ensure that all support and testing documentation meet or exceed agreed quality ITIL and other standards as required. Requirements Degree in an IT related discipline At least 10-12 years of information technology experience including at least 8 years of experience in Quality Assurance and Testing for Technology Applications Exposure of Core Banking applications (such as Temenos T24/AAA+/Avaloq) is mandatory Strong experience on working on Wealth Management channels with expert level knowledge on Asset Classes like Equities, Derivatives, FX and Fixed Income Financial technology background experience (Private Banking domain knowledge preferred) with experience in the Business analysis, Derivatives and Security Products, deployment and integration of vendor solutions Hands-on experience on Trading life cycle and Order Management Systems Visible leadership skills and comfortable leading cross-functional teams. Excellent organizational skills Well-acquainted with testing/certification processes, reporting templates, process and testing tools and methodologies Strong Experience on HP QC, QTP or relevant tools, prior experience in setting up Test Automation / Performance Testing Experience with waterfall / agile software development methodologies. Experience with CMMi and ISO standard procedures Demonstrated ability to lead complex testing projects and work cross-functionally Experience performing risk analysis as well as creating requirements traceability matrices, have an eye for quality and detail Demonstrated initiative and commitment to ongoing process improvement Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Strong trouble-shooting and problem-solving skills and ability to adapt to changing priorities    Interested candidates can email their resumes to Dipal on dipal.bhagde@theoptimum.net Optimum Solutions company registration: 199700895N

job_title: Portfolio & Program Manager, Technology Services ASPAC
job_details: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJohnson & Johnson Technology (JJT), Technology Services (TS), has an open position for Portfolio & Program Manager (PPM). The role is to support Johnson & Johnson Technology (JJT), Infrastructure and Applications Services in defining and delivering ASPAC portfolio of projects, working in alignment and collaboration with the Global Portfolio. The PPM is responsible to establish, monitor and manage the portfolio for TS ASPAC region.  A robust Portfolio & Program Management process is critical for enabling key decisions on where to focus both time and resources inorder to ensure that TS continues to deliver value to Johnson & Johnson and the businesses that we support.     The individual will have the following responsibilities: Portfolio Management  Guiding the selection, prioritization and balancing of the portfolio based on business and JJT strategic objectives and financial/resource constraints.   Continuous review of the portfolio and recommending reallocation, reprioritization and optimization of the portfolio based on progress of programs/projects, technology obsolescence, and evolving organizational objectives. Providing key stakeholders with timely assessment of projects pending selection, performance metrics and identification/recommendation to address portfolio issues affecting performance. Ensures the completeness and accuracy of portfolio data with project managers and other stakeholders, including Senior Management. Measure and monitor key performance indicators including portfolio value and project financials, including Plan vs. Committed vs. Actuals and driving benefit realization.  Support leadership level decision processes by providing timely communication to stakeholders on progress, changes and portfolio impacts. Drive/facilitate the portfolio governance processes and reviews, inclusive of Business Planning processes.   Provide input to and participate in key program/project reviews, including documenting executive summaries. Provide education and support for the portfolio related data and processes. Collaborate with peers to develop and execute portfolio and capacity planning processes within TS and across the sectors.  Continually strive to improve and evolve processes and develop organizational competencies in project planning and execution, resource management and benefit realization.  Establish, execute and monitor resource management processes as needed. Develop and deliver communication/change management and training in support of Portfolio activities. Measure and understand the total JJT financial health for scope of responsibility.  Be able to articulate financial implications of current year portfolio on future year operating costs. Develop processes to be able to report on budget to actual spend of the portfolio. Participate in cost reduction activities to as requested. Drive Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) awareness of portfolio.    Program Management  Work closely with all stakeholders to understand the business requirements, developing effective working relationships and on-going management processes for the delivery of the programs with the TS Portfolio.  Work with the Project Managers, to help estimate and plan projects from start to finish, with built in contingencies, aligning to the other project plans.  Resource Management planning and allocation of Program Managers and support the process of project prioritization, approval and initiation, including supplier selection if appropriate.  Mentor project managers and ensure external contractors working on projects understand project life cycle and QA requirements.  Work closely with other members of the TS Leadership Team to deliver organization objectives and ensure the business benefits and return on investment are realized.  Structure and daily-manage the PMO, looking to continuously improve and implement best practice. Produce, maintain and manage the roadmap of projects deliverables, over a rolling 12-month period.  Overall accountability for the budget management, monitoring expenditure and costs against delivered and realized benefits as the roadmap progresses Provide a quality assurance role ensuring that projects are well managed and adhering to appropriate standards and good practice.  Facilitate and manage portfolio issues and risks through to appropriate resolution, change management and budgetary control Identify and implement new and more efficient ways of working and promote best practices   TS Leadership Team (SLT) Operations & Communications  Organize and plan ASPAC TS LT meetings and events (such as monthly/quarterly review session, Business Planning activities etc.).  Build agendas with input from the leadership team, organize presentation materials and coordinate presenters. Manage Enterprise TS reporting requirements for Strategic Investments to senior leaders Mature TS Communications of accomplishments highlighting business value Drive organization headcount processes ensuring transparency of vacancies and managing attrition to achieve management decisions Serve as focal point to Finance organization to achieve financial objectives. RequirementsThe successful candidate must possess -  Bachelor’s degree (Business or Computer Science preferred) A minimum of 10-12 years progressive IT work experience is required.  Ability to think strategically and work independently is a must. Ability to understand the global and regional strategic goals and priorities and how the portfolio supports them.  Strong knowledge of portfolio and program management methodologies and tools, including project selection methods, prioritization processes, and models to support portfolio decision making.  Sound financial acumen with the ability to reconcile budgets.    Strong knowledge of program and project management processes and financial processes are required.  Must be highly analytical with a focus on business results. Strong collaboration skills are required.  Must be a results-driven with ability to effectively execute a variety of activities concurrently across local and global organizations. Ability to adapt and be flexibility to the changing needs and demands from JJT BT/PL team. Strong presentation, facilitation and communication skills and the ability to influence without authority are required.  Ability to translate data into information for executive audiences.  Proficient in use of standard office automation tools (Office 365), such as MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint, SharePoint.  Ability to work effectively with all levels of the organization.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe security incident management team (IM) prepares, identifies and responds to advanced and commodity security threats which could damage the Sony branding or cause (severe) financial impact. Your team ensures appropriate detection and response controls are in place to identify and handle incidents introduced through malware infections, phishing attacks, network attacks, server compromises, internal data leaks or fraudulent activities using IT. Scope of the engagement are all the sales & marketing companies, factories and R&D companies of Sony Electronics within the AP and China regions Your job will be:  Incident Management Team engineer for the AP and China regions with some extra focus on preparing Sony Electronics R&D Engineering companies for possible attacks Work with business to ensure all assets and key delivery processes are identified and at the highest state of Develop and utilize a case management process for incident and resolution tracking, including both current incidents and recording of previous anomalous or suspicious activity Direct and support incident response activity that involves investigating and analyzing a wide range of data sources, such as apparent security events, firewall logs, and forensic analysis, to identify viruses, malware, misuse, unauthorized activity and similar information security concerns Compile, track, and report monthly statistics on security incidents Ensure global incident response activities are prioritized and executed based on business criticality, reputational and financial impact, following optimal cost/benefit conditions. Primary business liaison for security incident related communication; legal entity heads, corporate communications, factory heads, R&D engineers, local IS support teams and others Deliver technical and business projects to increase maturity of the IM framework Ensure appropriate IR actions are performed in response to security incidents Maintain the formal incident management framework. Ensure playbooks are created and kept up to date RequirementsCore competence  Minimum 5 years’ experience in technical information security and incident response roles Demonstrated history of handling targeted security attacks Strong system engineering background (Windows, Linux) Strong IT or Security Operations background Experienced in log management and log correlation Experienced in using scripting languages and regex  Language  Fluent English and Chinese Mandarin  Personality  Creative, dynamic, open minded, pro-active and enthusiastic Able to self-control working day in an environment with a lot of freedom Result-focused, able to work under pressure Excellent interpersonal skills and common sense approach Willing and able to take the lead and to delegate tasks where necessary Passion for the job, accepts to work sporadically out of business hours  General skills  Excellent presentation skills Able to convey a message to senior management audience Excellent documentation skills  Interested applicants are welcome to apply to this position by clicking the "Apply Now" button and submitting your most updated CV.  Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_title: Senior Manager (Incident Response and Threat Management)
job_details: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) aspires to be a world-class organisation in delivering safety and security for our people. In pursuing our mission to make Singapore our Safe and Secure Best Home, we remain always constant and true to our core values of Honour and Unity. The job holder will investigate into cyber security events / incidents within MHA networks and at the same time he/she is solely responsible to establish cyber threat management (post deployment) framework, policies and procedures in MSOC. He/she is responsible for the following: Incident Response  Take charge of incidents or suspected incidents assigned by the Ops cluster and work towards establishing the confidentiality, integrity and availability (CIA Triangle) of information systems and data in MHA. Take lead in responding to incidents / threats in co-ordination with Home Team Department Security Incident Response Officers (SIROs). Collaborate with other cyber incident response agencies such as National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC), Government IT Security Incident Response (GITSIR) & Cyber-Watch Centre (CWC) so that there is proper coordination in reporting to internal and external stakeholders. Work with other IR members to review and update Security Incident Response Plan (SIRP) and response framework in MHA.  Threat Management  Develop assets protection and threat risk scoring program, charter, roadmap, and develop a governance programme for MHA. Compile the following information for internal use:   Indicators of compromise (IOC) Repository of cyber threat intelligence (both generic threats and threats that are directly relevant to MHA Infocomm Technology (ICT) environment)   Fusion of locally derived and externally sourced cyber threat intelligence into signatures, techniques, and analytics intended to detect and track the Advanced Persistent Threats (APTs). Active participation in cyber intelligence threat-sharing groups, typically composed of other Security Operation Centres (SOC) in both government and private sectors.  Job Requirements:  Tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Electronics Engineering or IT equivalent education and experience, preferably with advanced technical credentials. At least 8 years’ work experience in cyber-security and threat Intelligence related area preferably in large mission critical environment (e.g. Critical infrastructure systems), with 2 years in team management. At least 4 years’ working experience in Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT) or cyber incident response management. Certifications in CISSP, GCIH or GSEC are preferred. Government Home Team Ops knowledge and good understanding of their systems & networks are preferred. Strong experience analysing raw log files (i.e. firewall, IDS, PCAP, system logs), perform data correlation, security testing and penetration testing. Experience in troubleshooting and configuring networking devices, application platform, databases, Windows and UNIX system administration. Strong effective communications skills. Good time management and organizational skills. Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills. A team player with the ability to work autonomously.  All new appointees will be appointed on a two-year contract in the first instance. We wish to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified within 30 days upon closing of the advertisement.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout the Institute for Infocomm Research (I²R) The Institute for Infocomm Research (I²R) is a member of the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) family and is Singapore’s largest ICT research institute. Our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualization solutions. For more information about I2R, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sg Successful candidate will apply machine learning algorithms to develop an evaluation framework that will support a conversational A1 spoken dialogue system for studentsto assess how well they can speak a foreign language. Successful candidate will also develop solid engineering skills in deploying application systems and applied research experience of processing low-resource spoken languages, using techniques such as deep learning, transfer learning, unsupervised learning, reinforcement learning, domain and speaker adaptation, and GANs.Requirements Minimum Bachelor in Engineering Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Machine Learning with solid R&D experience or knowhow  Proficient in Python/Matlab/C++ programming   Knowledge in Deep Learning   The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified

Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Manager/Senior Manager uses data analytics and determines new strategies to make production processes more efficient to meet organisation's goals. He/She establishes, implements and manages projects to meet operational objectives. He/She manages his/her team resources and balances between production requirement and manpower resources to ensure organisation's sustainability. He/She integrates quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance within the organisation.  In addition the Manager/Senior Manager evaluates the organisation’s approach towards a lean enterprise and uses data analytics for business insights identification. He/She drives innovation practices in the organisation and review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimize inventory levels.  As a people manager, the Manager oversees manpower, financial, training and resource planning deployment within the organisation. He displays a high level of organisational awareness and leadership skills by working in a consultative manner with other departments/sections within the organisation.Requirements ~ Analyse data for business insights identification. ~ Analyse production efficiencies. ~ Conduct interviews and make hiring decisions. ~ Determine priorities dynamically and set planning assumptions for work in progress levels by product, cycle time and yield. ~ Develop On-the-job training programme. ~ Develop workplace learning plan. ~ Evaluate organisations approach towards a lean enterprise. ~ Evaluate the sustainability of manufacturing process by preparing rough cut capacity plans. ~ Evaluate workplace safety and health management system for compliance and improvement. ~ Improve operation planning through use of big data and advanced analytics modelling. ~ Integrate quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance. ~ Lead change management in the organisation. ~ Manage balance between production requirement and manpower resources. ~ Manage innovation practises in organisation. ~ Manage manufacturing key metrics including loading, performance to commitments, on time delivery and bottlenecks. ~ Manage material requirements planning taking into account the sales forecast, production plan and production capacity. ~ Resolve workplace grievances and disputes. ~ Review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimise inventory levels.

job_title: Assistant Finance Manager, Performance Management & Reporting
work_location: MAPLETREE BUSINESS CITY, 20 PASIR PANJANG ROAD 117439
job_details: Roles & ResponsibilitiesABOUT UNILEVER INTERNATIONAL: Unilever International (UI) is an alternative but complimentary route to market, servicing white space opportunities not exploited by local operating countries.  It is a global business unit with 9 hubs (Singapore, US, UK, Korea, India, Dubai, France, the Philippines and Australia) with a diverse range of products, with expertise in utilizing 3rd party distributors and consolidators to reach consumers in over 75 countries. UI have been operating successfully as an alternate Route to Market (RtM) to complement Multi-Country Organizations (MCOs) to serve these white spaces through a network of 500+ market expansion service providers and specialists via seeding initiatives. The market expansion providers or distributors in countries provide brand building and customer development services to UI under the agreed operating frameworks using the brand toolkits provided. UI have strategically evolved its portfolio from availability led growth to seeding in the last 5 years.  JOB TITLE: Assistant Finance Manager, Performance Management & Reporting JOB LOCATION: Singapore RELOCATION TERMS: Local terms  MAIN PURPOSE OF THE JOB: This role will also be involved in performance management and reporting. There will be an emphasis upon information management, process simplification and automation where possible, allowing way of workings driven commonly with faster speed among all the hubs.  The role needs to actively coordinate with the appropriate Unilever stakeholders to ensure a globally harmonized management reporting process for UI.  MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES: Performance Management and Reporting  Develop close working relationships with senior stakeholders globally to ensure alignment of monthly forecast for various business units (BU) within UI and ensuring accurate delivery of monthly financial forecast; Be the contact point for UI to help interface with global finance on reporting of results, ensuring timely and accurate submissions; Set up reporting units to enable seamless data flow through transactional system (ERP), data warehouse and Unilever reporting system; Assists with information management, process simplification and automation; Initiates continuous improvement for efficiently reporting purpose.  Analytics  Support the development of various performance measures targets; Analysis, insight and control over targets and actual performance measures; Assist in the work on strengthening of process for Information Analytics.  Others   Any other ad-hoc tasks required by the business.  RequirementsRELEVANT SKILL/ EXPERIENCE REQUIRED: Experience & Personal Characteristics Responsible for both financial analysis and business performance, the candidate must possess both strong quantitative abilities and excellent written and oral communication skills. They are strategic, analytical thinkers who are driven by results and can innovate and develop creative financial solutions. The candidate must have the necessary accounting qualifications (CPA/ACCA and/or past exposure to financial audit role is preferred) and is expected to have 5 years+ of holistic experience in different aspects of Finance and Accounting; Performance Management. Passion to learn and make a difference.  The candidate has high levels of self-assurance and shows resilience and belief in own ability to achieve goals. The individual will need to be a relationship builder and able to get things done independently. Must have a high level of integrity supported by strong interpersonal skills, good maturity and ability to communicate and manage well at all levels of the organization will be critical to the success of this role.  Lastly being part of the UI family, the candidate must be able to thrive in a fast paced and highly dynamic environment and navigate through complexities to arrive at solutions. He/she is expected to demonstrate the following leadership behaviors:  Strategic, Systemic Thinking & Entrepreneurial High Growth mind-set & Consumer/Shopper and Customer focus UL SOLs: Building talent and teams, Bias for action and change, Accountability and responsibility  Strong Communication & Influencing skills  Critical Competencies  Working knowledge of SAP or other similar accounting software systems Experience dealing with multiple currencies and exchange rates preferred Strong analytical and writing skills Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office software Ability to build effective working relationships and communicate at all levels within the organization    TO APPLY:  Please apply online by clicking on “Apply Online” below. Your application will be reviewed against our requirements. Should you not meet our immediate requirements, your profile will be registered in our talent pool system and we will match your profile to suitable future vacancies.  You will be able to access your status update through the candidate tracking link.  Thank you for your interest and application.  *We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be notified. Want to join our Talent Community? Please register your details here: http://unilever.avature.net/madebyyou?tags=singtc

job_title: Management Assistant Officer, SCALE (Programme and Student Administration)
job_details: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Purpose  The School of Continuing and Lifelong Education (SCALE) was established to drive the expansion of NUS’ Continuing Education and Training (CET) offerings in a concerted and strategic way that furthers our mission to be a leading global university, as well as fulfill our role as a public university of Singapore.  SCALE aims to:  Provide opportunities for working adults to acquire new knowledge and skills from a distinguished university; Help Singapore companies and industries stay competitive by providing lifelong learning experiences for their employees; and Effectively support national manpower needs.  Drawing on unparalleled access to the multi-disciplinary expertise of 16 other NUS Faculties/Schools, SCALE offers executive and professional development/training programmes, part-time degree programmes, as well as modular courses that may be taken singly or stacked towards certificates/diplomas/degrees that meet the lifelong learning needs of working adults.  All programmes are designed and developed in consultation with the industry to ensure relevance and currency. To augment the manpower in our Academic Programme Support Unit, we are looking for a diligent and meticulous individual to fill the position of a Management Assistant Officer. Reporting to the Head (Programme/Student Administration), the incumbent is a member of the team that strives to provide our teaching staff and students with high quality administrative support to facilitate a seamless and efficient experience at SCALE. Duties & Responsibilities: A. Programme Support   Prepare data for module registration in each semester and assist in students’ registration   Collate semestral nomination of teaching/support personnel to run all academic programmes   Manage the scheduling and grouping of tutorial and laboratory sessions   Manage/monitor students’ registration, progress and completion of the Final Year Project module   Monitor students’ graduation or programme completion status   Assist in conducting  programme surveys and provide data preparation support in the Student Feedback System   Arrange for students who are academically at risk to attend advisory sessions with academic staff   Process students’ requests for examination review   Provide support to ensure the smooth execution of examinations    B. Customer Care Support    Attend to telephone, walk-in and email enquiries   C. Others    Backup other colleagues in the function   Perform other duties, and/or participate in regular and ad-hoc events/projects, as may be assigned  RequirementsRequirements:   Polytechnic Diploma/GCE A-level or equivalent preferred   Preferably 1-2 years of related working experience   IT savvy and proficient in MS Office applications   Good verbal & written communication and interpersonal skills with a positive work attitude   Excellent coordination and organization skills, with a customer service mindset   Strong team player who is meticulous, resourceful, resilient and thrives in a fast-paced, results-oriented and ambiguous work environment   Experience in PeopleSoft Campus Solutions modules (in particular, Campus Community, Student Records, Student Financials, Campus Self-Service, Academic Advisement) an added advantage

job_title: Digital API & Agile Transformation Consultants - Senior Associate / Manager, Advisory
job_details: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe are a team of creative and inspiring designers, developers, and strategic thinkers that partner with our deep analytics team, customer journey design team to focus on the business and employee experience implications of digital-first for our clients.   About the opportunity Digital API & Agile Transformation Consultants at EY Digital are the engine room of our business, working on the front lines with our client, colleagues and third-parties to execute the digital business vision. We work across industries and markets, cross-pollinating the best of digital, customer, strategy and technology to help our clients monetize data and design new services through API solutions, and help execute digital transformation through large scale agile methodologies and modern agile development platforms. And at the heart of it all, embed customer centric experience design in how we execute. Digital API & Agile Transformation Consultants embrace an achievement focused culture within EY, living EY’s core values, and positively influencing our culture more widely through the collaborative engagement of other internal teams to deliver leading practice digital strategy, innovation, customer experiences and digital operations.   Key Responsibilities:  Feel excited working with multiple parts of the businesses across multiple industries, solutioning and delivering complex digital solutions You find yourself always wanting to innovate and shape the industry, wanting to differentiate You have been known to be able to understand both sides of a coin, the business aspect and the technology aspect of things You believe that Design Thinking and is the way to go in everything that we do, and Agile Methodologies can be applied appropriately in how we execute   RequirementsSkills and Attributes for success  You always see yourself as someone who likes being near the businesses and is always passionate about looking for opportunities in turning day to day business challenges into digital solutions You enjoy communicating with people from various background and skill sets across an organisation, and has always been great at communicating an idea or POV across various channels and mediums    To qualify for the role, you must have:  Minimum of three years' experience as an internal or external consultant working on business transformation, product, operations and/or technology projects in a digital environment Experience of multi-channel digital environments having worked in professional services and/or customer focused companies Skilled in all aspects of Design Thinking including user research, functional requirements definition, business process analysis, job_title: Project Buyer (West, ERP, SAP / R3, Up to $4.4K)
job_details: Roles & Responsibilities A well-established US Manufacturing MNC.  Responsibilities:​  Responsible for the disposition of material according given demand in CIP’s (Continuous Improvement Project) andCSR's (Customer Specific Requirement), achieving lowest possible cost with shortest possible lead time, OTD (On Time Delivery) and up to our quality standards. Implement 6R of the Logistics -» Right Material, Right Price, Right Quality, Right Time, Right Place, Right Conditions.  Key Responsibilities: CIP & CSR  Disposing and ordering material for CIP's and CSR's according to demand in the ERP system (SAP). Work closely with local production planning. Work with the supplier to agree on corrective actions to resolve escalated issues (e.g. chasing supplier for OTD) or look for alternative suppliers when necessary. Request and analyze quotations. Negotiate prices based on open calculation, lead-time, landed cost and total cost. Issuing PO’s (Purchase Orders) related to quotations.  NPI’s  Support NPI (New Product Introduction), DAPI (DA Product Innovation) and LLI (Long Lead Item). Issuing QC’s (Quantity Contracts) and Call Offs related to QC's or PO's  (Purchase Orders) related to quotations. Work closely with Global Strategic Supply Management (support of supplier evaluation, phasing in new products, and in managing of demand request for Project-Material Orders) and Operational Purchasing in Asia (Malaysia and China).  Generic  Hand over engineering change requests to suppliers (close team work with Manufacturing Engineering). Prepare analysis and statistics to control and support the sourcing strategy and the strategic planning. Proactive improvement of the quality along the entire supply chain in close cooperation with all involved Departments (Product Group, Research & Development, Material Management, and Finance). Control and verify invoices with price deviations referring to PO. Make sure that all necessary purchasing parameters (vendor data, contracts) are given and stored properly and take appropriate actions whenever necessary. Improvement programs correspondingly. Monitor the supplier performance, conduct regular supplier assessments and audits, and prepare analysis.​   RequirementsRequirements:  Degree in Mechanical Engineering. 5 years' experience in Global sourcing (Asia focused, Asian supply market knowledge). Experience in supplier qualifications, auditing and corrective action processes. Experience in SAP/R3. Excellent negotiation skills. Experience in execution of total daily business of material purchasing, establishment of timely availability of all orderedmaterials and services and optimization of material flow and of inventory level. Able to optimize the supplier relationship by combining supplier's and internal processes. Good understanding of the Supply Chain, the critical production and assembly processes.  Other Information:  Working Location: Science Park. Working Hours: Mondays to Fridays, 8.30am to 5.30pm.  To apply, please visit www.gmprecruit.com and search for Job Reference: 13860. To learn more about this opportunity, please contact Novita Tan at novita.adisutanto@gmprecruit.com We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. GMP Recruitment Services (S) Pte Ltd | EA License: 09C3051 | EA Personnel: Novita Tan | Registration No: R1220374

job_cat: Healthcare / Pharmaceutical, Information Technology, Sciences / Laboratory / R&D
job_details: Roles & ResponsibilitiesLooking to work with other driven programmers, engineers and designers on ground breaking medical technology? Skin cancer diagnosis is currently a slow, expensive and none-too-accurate process. Here at Iko, we have been working hard on our patent-pending imaging technology and are developing our platform to increase early cancer detection and save lives. We’re now looking for world-class talent to join our development team. Iko is a small, Singapore based startup with clinical trials taking place in some of the most prestigious facilities in the world. Our office is in a beautiful modern shophouse, accompanied by a variety of other startups under one umbrella company. Enjoy the closeness of a small startup team, with the vibrancy of a communal environment. As part of a small close-knit team, you’ll be working directly on core product development and will have direct impact on the success of our venture. The ideal candidate will be a highly motivated developer to take charge of the development of our embedded device application software, running on the NVIDIA Jetson TX2 SoM. The role includes implementing the necessary algorithms for real-time data processing, user feedback and device control. We offer:  A supportive, informal environment of other experienced programmers, engineers and designers. Complex and meaningful work, with the opportunity to see for yourself how clinicians, patients and healthcare systems stand to benefit. Good monthly salary; performance-based annual bonus. Requirements Qualifications in Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent experience. Highly proficient in C++. Highly proficient in parallel computing with CUDA. Experience developing on the NVIDIA Tegra based SoC / SoM (NVIDIA Jetson) highly advantageous. Knowledge and experience in Computer Vision and 3D Graphics highly advantageous. Initiative and a strong sense of personal responsibility. Tenacity to solve hard and interesting problems. Able to work both independently and collaboratively. Strong troubleshooting, debugging and problem-solving skills.

company_name: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
job_details: Roles & ResponsibilitiesYou will be responsible for supporting the Group Centre of Excellence in leading and managing costing and pricing process across NUHS.    He/she will be expected to:  Interpret policies and guidelines from Ministry of Health (MOH) and work closely with the institutions to implement the policies. Review the current costing/pricing process and the dependencies of each respective institution and develop overall costing/pricing policies, guidelines and parameters Harmonize and align a set of costing methodology and a systematic approach of collating costing data within the Cluster. Develop a group policy on costing of services and an alternative costing model eg: ABC costing. Review the service categories and current pricing policy and align where possible to adopt a standard policy within the Cluster. Run benchmark exercise across Cluster. Work on the costing algorithms to determine the rebase costs across the respective Institutions. Follow up on the findings from the costing process study and propose recommendation/approach to streamline costing methodology within the Cluster and at the same time aligning to NCG guideline. Organize regular meeting with Institutions on sharing of issues, processes and workflows and adopting best practices across the Cluster. Attend related internal and external costing and pricing meetings eg: Cosys, BT and update the Institutions. Provide regular updates to the GCFO and Institution CFOs on the progress of Costing & Pricing. Identify and implement continuous productivity improvement opportunities through process efficiencies or automation. Requirements You should possess a Degree in Accountancy, Finance, Business and a minimum of 3-5 years of relevant experience in Finance or Audit. Applicants with more than 6 years of relevant experience may be considered for Manager position. Acute business acumen and understanding of organization issues and challenges. Experience in developing new costing/pricing methodologies and guidelines and lead in the change process is preferred. Ability to analyze different types of data and data evaluation metrics. Ability to work independently and as a team with minimal supervision, incredibly organized and execution focused. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, verbal and written. Proficient in SAP and MS Office Applications (Advance) such as Words, Excel and PowerPoint.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe School of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering (MAE) boasts comprehensive state-of-the-art facilities and a faculty comprising more than 130 professors, making it one of the largest mechanical engineering schools in the world. Faculty members are drawn from renowned universities worldwide, providing a wealth of collective expertise in traditional mechanical and aerospace engineering, and in specialities including manufacturing, mechatronics, innovative design, nanotechnology, and biomedical and computational applications.  The Additive Microstructure Engineering Laboratory (AddME Lab) at the Nanyang Technological University (NTU, Singapore) invites applications for a postdoctoral research position with focus on “Inferring grain boundary crystallography-property relations using high-throughput experiments”. The work will focus on assessing the property value of thousands of individual grain boundaries with known crystallography using our high-throughput experimental techniques. The large data set will be fed into neural-network-models to predict materials properties as a function of the grain boundary character distribution. Materials of interest will be polycrystalline metals and alloys for structural applications.Requirements PhD degree in Materials Science, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field Knowledge of polycrystalline metal and crystallography Knowledge of intergranular corrosion processes Expertise in microstructure characterization (e.g. metallography and EBSD)    We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

work_location: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 8 MARINA BOULEVARD 018981
job_details: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Engineering & Operations Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another. The role: Software Engineer - Singapore Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward. Responsibilities: - Write mobile applications, create robust high-volume production applications and develop prototypes quickly.RequirementsMinimum qualifications: - Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics/Mathematics, related field or equivalent practical experience. - Experience in mobile application development. - Programming experience in Java, Objective-C, C++, or Python. Preferred qualifications: - Deep technical knowledge of mobile application development (either Android or iOS). - Significant programming experience in either Java, Objective-C or C++.

work_location: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 8 MARINA BOULEVARD 018981
job_details: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWhy Standard Chartered? We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.  To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit.  It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. Why FM Technology? The Financial Markets IT function is responsible for the systems development and technology infrastructure which underpin the Bank’s services for Financial Markets clients. FM TPT is a dynamic and diverse team within the FM IT department spread across multiple global locations and is focused on enhancing the technical and operational capabilities of the Financial Markets trade and post trade functions. It is a forward thinking and highly productive area and an excellent place for technologists and associated support functions to succeed in a rapidly changing and challenging environment. Job Description The global securities transformation and settlements team requires a project manager to support the delivery of several technology work streams. This critical project role will incorporate many deliverables. The successful candidate will be an experienced project manager with a track record of 3 + years in delivering, complex projects. The successful candidate is expected to: Key Roles & Responsibilities Coordinating with cross discipline team members to make sure that all parties are on track with project requirements, deadlines, and schedules. Ensure that the project is managed in line with good project management practices Define and formulate the implementation plan (including key dependencies, resource requirements and interlocks Provide periodic project updates to project working group and steering committees Define and monitor at a work stream level key risk and issues and manage them as defined in PMP guidelines Work closely with the Group Functions and Business Areas to implement / enhance data quality controls and documentation. Preparing status reports by gathering, analysing and summarizing relevant information. Establishing effective project communication plans and ensuring their execution. Managing senior project stakeholder expectations on project delivery Facilitating change requests to ensure that all parties are informed of the impacts on schedule and budget. Conducting post project evaluation and identifying successful and unsuccessful project elements.RequirementsQualifications & Skills At least 3 years in a Settlements and/or Securities roles At least 3 years in a role in banking technology Proven experience in project management Confident, proactive and responsible Strong communication and time management skills Strong presentation skills Strong analytical skills Proficient in MS Office Relevant PM certification (PMP/CAPM, etc) Bachelor’s degree in business, technology or a related field, or equivalent Flexible and ability to adapt to change Desirable but not Essential Experience with Financial Markets banking Experience of technology project deliveries Experience of working in an AGILE environment How to Apply Please visit - https://scb.taleo.net/careersection/ex/jobdetail.ftl?job=1900000845&lang=en  to apply now and take the next step in fulfilling your potential. You can search and view current opportunities across our global organisation and apply immediately by visiting www.standardchartered.com. To help speed up your application, please note the following:  You will need to log in (or register if you are visiting our careers site for the first time) before you can apply for a specific role Some roles may require you to undertake an online talent assessment in addition to completing the application form (to facilitate this process it is preferable that you provide us with an email address as part of your contact information) We will ask you about your education, career history and skills and experience, it may be helpful to have this information at hand when completing your application  It usually takes 15 - 20 minutes to complete the application form; you can save your application at any time and return to complete it at your convenience. Diversity & Inclusion Standard Chartered is committed to diversity and inclusion. We believe that a work environment which embraces diversity will enable us to get the best out of the broadest spectrum of people to sustain strong business performance and competitive advantage. By building an inclusive culture, each employee can develop a sense of belonging, and have the opportunity to maximise their personal potential.
